update.description:
This version of the library should allow to publish/subscribe messages between nodes and make synchronous and asynchronous service call requests. The messages are typed and if the nodes are within the same process, no serialization should be done.

Requires: zeromq, czmq, robot_msgs, protobuf, and uuid-dev. It also requires c++11 (as probably most of the ignition projects).

Take a look at src/Node_TEST to see how to use the library while I'm writing the tutorials.

From a design point of view, these are the building blocks I've used to create a node in each process.

```
 _______   _______
|       | |       |
| Node 1| | Node 2|
|_______| |_______|
|                 |
|   Node Shared   |
|_________________|
|                 |
|     Discovery   |
|_________________|
     (Process1)
```

This is the [drone.io
job status](https://drone.io/bitbucket.org/ignitionrobotics/ign_transport).

[![Build Status](https://drone.io/bitbucket.org/ignitionrobotics/ign_transport/status.png)](https://drone.io/bitbucket.org/ignitionrobotics/ign_transport/latest)
update.title: Initial complete version

content.raw: Most other functions in this library return booleans. Is there a reason to return an integer for this function instead of a boolean?
content.html: Most other functions in this library return booleans. Is there a reason to return an integer for this function instead of a boolean?

content.raw: A singleton shouldn't have a public constructor or destructor. Take a look at [this singleton template](https://bitbucket.org/osrf/gazebo/src/381eab2df00b06c414534a1e1c06920d6475c987/gazebo/common/SingletonT.hh?at=default).
content.html: A singleton shouldn't have a public constructor or destructor. Take a look at this singleton template.

content.raw: Can you go through all the files, and change the `/// \class` lines to be: `/// \class CLASSNAME FILE.hh ignition/transport/FILE.hh`? For example: `/// \class Node Node.hh ignition/transport/Node.hh`
content.html: Can you go through all the files, and change the /// \class lines to be: /// \class CLASSNAME FILE.hh ignition/transport/FILE.hh? For example: /// \class Node Node.hh ignition/transport/Node.hh
